fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46604].
  {panel}

h4. Background
[~zverev.vasiliy35530848045926] noticed this issue on Atlassian Answers and posted a new question when he couldn't proceed -- [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35772255]. It seems he's using an invalid URL because the ID of the Answer in the URL doesn't match content on the Question in question.

This is an issue because accessing Confluence Questions via an invalid link may not be a common problem, but it's easy to accidentally append or subtract a single letter from a URL when copy-pasting. This may be more widespread than we think.

When navigating to non-existant Questions, we get a message that the Question doesn't exist. When navigating to non-existant Comments on an actual Question, there is no issue. When navigating to non-existant Answers on an actual Question, we have a problem.

h4. Steps to reproduce
Click the following URL to an answer on Atlassian Answers: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35762363/answers/35771303

This URL is referencing two pieces of content -- 
# *Question* 35762363
# *Answer* 35771303

h4. Expected results
* The question (35762363) should load
* The answer (35771303) should be highlighted
* All page content should load properly

h4. Actual results
* The question (35762363) loads
* The answer is not highlighted
* The answer is of a different ID than one would expect from the URL (*{color:red}35763985{color}*)
* The sidebar of 'related questions' does not render (see image) \\  !image-2016-02-03-21-55-29-312.png|thumbnail! 
* Comment and Answer editors do not load (see image) \\ !image-2016-02-03-22-00-34-378.png|thumbnail! 
* The following line is added to the browser console when clicking inside of an editor \\ {noformat}Bootstrap:initialise: No settings found. Has preInitialise been called?{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to load all content when accessing CQ via a URL that references a nonexistent answer

h3. Summary
The 'What do you want to know about x space' grey text is broken when special characters are used

h3. Notes
Versions replicated in:
* 2.1.13-D20150826T104746
* 2.2.0
* 2.1.5

Special characters observed so far:
* '
* =

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46588].
{panel}
CQ appears to be waiting for a lock that is locked by the index, which is currently trying to process a large amount of updates.
{code:java}
"http-nio-8081-exec-3" #252 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f8bbc15e800 nid=0x1f91 waiting on condition [0x00007f8930951000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
        at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
        - parking to wait for  <0x00000005e0802508> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
...
        at com.atlassian.bonnie.LoggingReentrantLock.lock(LoggingReentrantLock.java:32)
        at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:483)
{code}
The thread 'http-nio-8081-exec-3 is a doeditquestion.action:
||Thread ID||Thread name||User ID||Type||Summary||Duration||
|252|http-nio-8081-exec-3|amckague|web-request|/cq/doeditquestion.action?id=2669904138|1 hour, 16 minutes, 20 seconds|

The only threads that are getting stuck are CQ threads (see screenshot). Why would we be blocking on a Lucene lock in CQ?

!cq stuck requests.png|height=450!
h3. Impact of this bug

This bug can cause threads to become stuck, which means indexing does not occur, and questions/answers cannot be posted to Confluence Questions (they simply hang). A restart of the instance (or a rolling restart of the full cluster) is required to resolve it.

It can also cause indexing to be delayed after a restart, by up to 20m, depending on the size of your instance.
fields.summary: Confluence Questions is waiting for a lock that is locked by the index

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A user with either the Confluence Administrator or System Administrator permission will receive a notification for a question that is tagged with a 'watched' topic even when the question is posted in a restricted space. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test user such as 'notificationuser'
# In Global Permissions, grant the Confluence Administrator and/or System Administrator permission to the test user account
# With the test user account, follow a topic such as 'topictofollow'
# Log in using a different user that has 'Create Space' permissions
# Create a new space and restrict the user created in Step 1
# Create a new question in the space created and tag it with the followed topic (i.e. topictofollow)

h3. Expected Results

The user will not receive a notification as they do not have access to the Space.

h3. Actual Results

A notification/email is received. Clicking the link included in the email will lead to a "Page Not Found" error as the page is not accessible to the user.

h3.Workaround

Atlassian recommends not using your administration account for regular use of Confluence. Create separate admin and user accounts instead.
fields.summary: Users with the Confluence Administrator or System Administrator permissions receive notifications to questions tagged with watched topics in restricted spaces

h3. Summary

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results

To be able to share Confluence Question post without any errors.

{code}

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Sometimes any operations on the index, for example searching, will cease functioning. In the logs there will be an error like:

{code:none}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearchUnavailableException: com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException: this IndexReader is closed
{code}

h4. Cause

The org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException exception is not being handled correctly.

h4. Workaround

One of the following will get it working again:

# Restart Confluence
# [Rebuild Indexes from scratch|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-server-110035351.html]
fields.summary: Index stops functioning because org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException is not handled correctly

h3. Steps to reproduce # Create a blank page; # Drag and drop a file and check the storage format. It should look like this: {code:xml}

250

{code} # Go to *Cog icon > Add-ons > All add-ons* search for *Confluence View File Macro* and disable it; # Back to the page, we see {{Unknown macro: 'view-file'}} instead of the dropped file (expected); # Edit the page but do not touch the View File macro. Save the page # Manage add-ons screen again, enable *Confluence View File Macro*; *Expected behavior* The files are displayed back properly. *Actual Behavior* {{(!) Broken Macro}} message where there should be a file. The macro was corrupted during the page edit/save while the Confluence View File Macro plugin was disabled. In the storage format, we see missing parameters in the macro structure: {code:xml}

pdf_sample.pdf 250

{code} h3. Workaround # Restore the previous version of the page saved before the macro was disabled. # Use the respective view macro depending on the file type (PDF, Word, Excel, PPT)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server* and *Data Center*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46556].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Pasting images from the clipboard into a Confluence Page does not work (only some times).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a file from the web, from a desktop file or from a screenshot
# On the Confluence editor, right-click with the mouse and select "Paste"

h3. Expected Results
The image will be uploaded and inserted into the Page's body.

h3. Actual Results
The image gets uploaded, but is not inserted into the Page's body.

PS: we can confirm the image is uploaded from the Attachments section on the Page.

h3. Workaround
1. Use the keyboard shortcut (Ctrl+v for Windows or Cmd+v for MacOS) to Paste the image.
2. Save the image to a local desktop file and use the "Drag and Drop" feature.
3. Use the "Insert files or images" button to open the file navigator on the computer. Then, select a file and proceed with the upload of the attachment.

h3. Notes

Firefox 51.0.1 - Drag and drop works, copy and paste doesn't work and brings a sample png
Chrome 56.0.2924.87 - Drag and drop works, copy and paste doesn't work and brings file name only eg: sample.jpg
Safari 9.1.2 - Drag and drop works, copy and paste brings the local path of the file to the page  e.g: file://Userdirectory/folder/file.jpg

Nothing relevant on the logs.

Copying and paste or drag and dropping the file from the Sketch editor doesn't work in Chrome.
fields.summary: As a Confluence user I would like to copy and paste attachments from the clipboard to a Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46555].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Some customers would access Atlassian Cloud application within their corporate network. If some domains that are needed by Confluence are blocked by their firewall or proxy, the application will not work properly on the client. 

 

Suggested Solution

Create a guideline on what domains should be accessible within corporate networks for Confluence to work properly (i.e. for images, css, cdn, etc..).
h3. Why this is important

This is important to help network administrators set up their network to allow access to Confluence on cloud.
fields.summary: Documentation guidelines for accessing cloud instances

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Install Confluence 5.10.x
 # Install JIRA Software 7.0.x
 # Create Application Link using 2-Legged Oauth
 # Link page to issue and vice versa
 # JIRA Link will appear as per shown in example  !ExpectedBehaviour.png|thumbnail!
 # Shutdown JIRA and Confluence
 # Startup Confluence first
 # Once Confluence is up and running, startup JIRA
 # Link another JIRA issue to Confluence page

 
h3. Expected Result

Confluence will show JIRA Links as shown below

!ExpectedBehaviour.png!

 
h3. Actual Result

Page is linked, but the JIRA Links is not shown

!BugMissingJIRALinks.png!

 

 
h3. Workaround

Ensure to start Confluence only when JIRA is already up and running.
fields.summary: JIRA Link is not shown in Confluence when JIRA is not yet running while Confluence is starting up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46546].
  {panel}

When renaming word documents in confluence, the images do not repopulate to the page that is inheriting the document. Example:
 # Upload a word document with images to a page
 # Use the word macro and inherit the word document on the screen
 # Change the name of the word document
 # The images do not populate tot he screen
 # The only way to repopulate the images is to download th document and re-post it in Confluence
fields.summary: Renaming word docs within Confluence causes images to disappear

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46544].
  {panel}

This is a request from the customer to improve the SSL implementation steps related to CA certificate. In this case, they provided steps for the StartSSL CA.

The customer faced some issues during the integration with Hipchat and created a guideline.

Steps:
{quote}
IMPORTANT: private key and keystore password need to be the SAME. If not then you need to specifiy the password for the private key *6)
1) Create CSR and private key on your linux box:
openssl req -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout private.key -out request.csr -subj "/C=na/ST=None/L=None/O=None/CN=None"
2) Create certificate with the generated CSR for your domain. (in StartSSL go to "Certificates Wizard", paste the generated CSR for your domain and submit. Download and extract the certificate and CA Chain.)
3) Create PFX file from certificate (step 2), private key (step 1) and Certificate Chain (step 2 - root bundle or intermediate cert depending on CA):
openssl pkcs12 -export -out <PFX-filename>.pfx -inkey private.key -in <your-certificate>.crt -certfile <CA-chain-file>.crt
(you can use the same password for the PFX file as for the private key to make things easier - we won't need the PFX file later and can destroy it)
The output should read like this:
>Enter pass phrase for private.key:
>Enter Export Password:
>Verifying - Enter Export Password:
4) Convert the PFX into a Java keystore. In your JRE bin directory on your linux box execute:
./keytool -importkeystore -srckeystore <PFX-filename>.pfx -destkeystore <new-keystore-file>.keystore -srcstoretype PKCS12 -deststoretype JKS
IMPORTANT: Use the SAME PASSWORD for the keystore as for the private key from step 1)! otherwise see *6)
The output should read like this:
>Enter destination keystore password:
>Re-enter new password:
>Enter source keystore password:
>Entry for alias 1 successfully imported.
>Import command completed:  1 entries successfully imported, 0 entries failed or cancelled
5)Edit your server.xml, uncomment the <Connector port="8443> and point the keystore entry to your <new-keystore>.keystore and supply the keystore password from step 1. (keystoreFile="<new-keystore>.keystore" keystorePass="<password from step 1>")
*6) If you want to set different passwords for the private key and the keystore then you have to:
./keytool -keypasswd -keystore /path/to/keyestore.file -alias <alias-in-keystore>
If you're not sure about the alias: ./keytool -list -keystore <name-of-keystore>
*7) Alternative to creating a PFX file including the CA chain file:
./keytool -importcert -alias startssl-CA-chain -keystore <path-to-atlassian-directory>/jre/lib/security/cacerts -file <CA Chain Cert in PEM format>.crt
{quote}
fields.summary: SSL documentation improve request for CA SSL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Uploading some XLSX files to Confluence can cause OutOfMemory error while generating preview.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload with 700x40 XLSX file to Confluence
 # Open file in preview window

h3. Expected Results

Preview generated or "Not possible to preview" showed.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence became unresponsive.
 The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out file:
{noformat}
22-Feb-2017 16:41:32.141 SEVERE [http-nio-8081-ClientPoller-0] org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$Poller.run
 java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
        at java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableCollection.iterator(Collections.java:1038)
        at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$Poller.timeout(NioEndpoint.java:1287)
        at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$Poller.run(NioEndpoint.java:1094)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log:
{noformat}
2017-02-22 16:41:35,731 ERROR [conversion-thread-0] [plugins.conversion.impl.TimeoutConversionRunnable] run Cannot convert. Execution error:
 -- url: /display/DEMO/NEW+XLS+test | page: 917505 | traceId: 4ecd169c1d90bb85 | userName: admin | referer: http://ec2-54-229-125-162.eu-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com:8081/ | action: viewpage
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
        at com.aspose.cells.zth.b(Unknown Source)
        at com.aspose.cells.zth.a(Unknown Source)
        at com.aspose.cells.zth.a(Unknown Source)
        at com.aspose.cells.zth.a(Unknown Source)
        at com.aspose.cells.zth.a(Unknown Source)
        at com.aspose.cells.zbwm.a(Unknown Source)
        at com.aspose.cells.SheetRender.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.conversion.convert.image.CellsConverter.generateThumbnailDirect(CellsConverter.java:102)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.JVMConversionRunnable.generateThumbnail(JVMConversionRunnable.java:109)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.JVMConversionRunnable.doWork(JVMConversionRunnable.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable.run(ConversionRunnable.java:36)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.JVMConversionRunnable.run(JVMConversionRunnable.java:22)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
h3. Heap Dump Analysis

!Screen Shot 2017-02-23 at 10.33.27.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-23 at 10.35.04.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Upgrade the Document Conversion add-on with the latest version, below
 * Download the right *document-conversion-library-x.x.xx.jar*
||Confluence version ||Document Library  Version||
|6.0 - 6.4|Document conversion [1.2.25|https://packages.atlassian.com/maven-closedsource-local/com/atlassian/plugins/document-conversion-library/1.2.25/document-conversion-library-1.2.25.obr] ([mirror|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oqv9iuJDnsxE_aRRRMOQ6Yc0DHOoJlnl/view?usp=sharing])|
|h4. after 6.4|Document conversion [2.0.2.1|https://packages.atlassian.com/maven-closedsource-local/com/atlassian/plugins/document-conversion-library/2.0.2.1/document-conversion-library-2.0.2.1.jar] |

 * Install the add on by file upload, as per [installing plugins |https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/installing-add-ons-273875715.html#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload]

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The *Add Page* space permission is what grants users the ability to reorder pages in Confluence. There are cases where users should be able to add pages, but not have the ability to reorder pages in a space. Moreover, when page restrictions are in place for hierarchies in a space, users who are restricted from seeing other hierarchies have the ability to reorder pages of restricted hierarchies, even though they cannot edit them. 

This poses an issue for proper documentation, as users can easily move pages, even if they are restricted from editing. A similar feature request was submitted (CONF-24901), but was marked as incomplete. 

h3. Suggested Solution
There are two ways around this: 
# Create a separate space permission for *Reorder page*.
# Create a new page restriction that denies everyone from moving pages in the hierarchy, except for select users or groups. 

Out of the two, number 1 would likely be best.

h3. Why this is important
This is important because users should be able to add pages without having the ability to completely transform the hierarchy of a space. 

h3. Workaround 
There is no real workaround. That said, you can create separate spaces for different hierarchies so that only users who should be able to reorder pages can do so in their own space without affecting other hierarchies in the original space.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to add pages without also granting reorder page permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46520].
  {panel}

When someone that I follow likes a comment, I get an email notification with the content of the comment, a link to the context of the comment, and the name of the person who liked it. This is very useful.

However, one important bit of information missing: the author of the comment. As I'm quickly scanning through liked  comments in my email notifications, I'd really like to know who made these insightful comments without having to click through.

h3.Steps 

 # Someone I follow likes a comment.
 # I get an email notification about the like. I read it directmy in the email, while I'm off the Atlassian network. I'm impressed by the comment and start thinking about how I could respond... And I realise I need to know who wrote it in order to write a considerate response.
 # I scan the notification for the author, bit it isn't there. I have to join the VPN, click through the notification to find the author, by which time my flow is broken.


 *What should have happened...*

 # Someone I follow likes a comment.
 # I get an email notification about the like, which includes not just the name of the liker and the body of the comment, but also the author of the comment.
fields.summary: It'd be great if email notifications about someone liking a comment showed who authored the comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46512].
  {panel}

I documented issue here on the forum but no action or response was seen.

[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/43904592/fail2ban-advice-looks-wrong]

The advice [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-fail2ban-to-limit-login-attempts-216433031.html] is incorrect.

 


Because Confluence lacks a CSRF token on the login box.
Because the advice suggests tracking "GET /login.action"

But there is no need to "GET /login.action" to log into Confluence, so tracking it is of zero value as a defence mechanism.

The advice should suggest "POST /dologin.action" as a minimum (the authentication people may know of other URLs that need to be included).

Confluence should consider adding a CSRF prevention token to the login form, so that you must fetch the login form before logging in.
fields.summary: The website security advice on fail2ban is wrong

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you try to create a page using a user created template by accessing it through this direct URL: 
* {{<base-url>/pages/createpage-choosetemplate.action?spaceKey=<space-key>&newspaceKey=<new-space-key>&fromPageId=<page-id>}}

You will receive a 'Not Permitted' error message. This happens to users who are not part of the 'confluence-administrators' group in Confluence.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Login as a user who's a space administrator for any space.
# Create a user template for that space at {{Space Tools > Content Tools > Create New Template}} and save it.
# Try to access this URL: {{<base-url>/pages/createpage-choosetemplate.action?spaceKey=<space-key>&newspaceKey=<new-space-key>&fromPageId=<page-id>}}

h3. Expected results
The user should be able to pick which user template to use and proceed with the page creation.

 !Create from Template.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results
The user gets notified that they do not have permission and sees this error.

 !Not Permitted.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
Try to repeat the steps to replicate using a user who's part of the 'confluence-administrators' group and you should be able to get the expected results.
fields.summary: Can't create page from template through direct URL due to 'Not Permitted' error unless you're a member of the 'confluence-administrators' group

I've got an automated analysis task that produces a very large amount of data daily, and I would like to present this data as an interactive page on Confluence.

The data is in the form of xml reports, and I plan to make these human readable via css/xslt.

It appears I can embed external content via the html/iframe widget, however I can't get it to work with any of the obvious hosting options available. I've tried google drive, teamspace, and SVN. Google drive doesn't appear allow raw content access via javascript, and svn and teamspace have cross site scripting disabled.

It would be good for Confluence to incorporate something that allows for this functionality.

fields.description:
h3. Description
* JIRA service desk is integrated with a confluence space 
* User have account in both JIRA and Confluence
* The Anonymous user have the permission to view the space but does not have the permission to add page in the space.

When a user login to JIRA service desk and tried to create a knowledge base, it will be redirected to confluence create page and load forever. This is because the user is not login to confluence and treated as an anonymous user that has the view space permission but does not have the add page permission for the space.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a space in confluence
# Give anonymous user view space permission and not the add page permission
# Integrate a JIRA service desk project with the space created in step 1
# login JIRA and access the JIRA service desk. (Ensure user is not login to confluence)
# Tried to create a knowledge base
# The user will be redirected to confluence and the page will load forever until user login to confluence

*Expected behavior*
The user should be redirected to the login page

*Actual Result*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Confluence should check if the user exists and redirect the user to login page before redirect user to the create page link .
fields.summary: Unable to create knowledge page from JIRA Service Desk and the create page macro keep loading forever when if user have the view space permission but not the add page permission
